title: New York Yankees-Houston Astros ALCS Game 4 is rained out, postponed to Thursday night
text:
CLOSE

NEW YORK - They'll have to wait another day.

A forecast of all-day rain forced postponement of Wednesday's Game 4 of the American League Championship Series at Yankee Stadium.

With the Houston Astros leading the New York Yankees 2-1 in the best-of-seven series, Game 4 will now be played at 8:08 p.m. Thursday at Yankee Stadium.

Friday's Game 5 in the Bronx is 7:08 p.m.

This will eliminate the scheduled travel day on Friday; Games 6 and 7, if necessary, would be played on Saturday and Sunday at Houston's Minute Maid Park.

Due to the rainout, Yankees manager Aaron Boone is likely to start Masahiro Tanaka on regular rest in Game 4, while Astros manager A.J. Hinch will bring back Zack Greinke - creating a rematch of Game 1, won by the Yankees, 7-0.

Houston's Justin Verlander is now scheduled to pitch on regular rest against the Yankees' James Paxton in Friday's Game 5.

If there's a Game 6, it could be a bullpen battle for both clubs, with the Yankees possibly going to J.A. Happ for length. And a Game 7, if necessary, could be a rematch of Luis Severino and Gerrit Cole on regular rest.

Pete Caldera is the Yankees beat writer for NorthJersey.com. Email: caldera@northjersey.com Twitter: @pcaldera
description: A forecast of all-day rain forced postponement of Wednesday's Game 4 of the ALCS at Yankee Stadium. Game 4 will be played Thursday night.
